metadata.Title: CVE-2016-5011 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - low.
metadata.Description:
The parse_dos_extended function in partitions/dos.c in the libblkid library in util-linux allows physically proximate attackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption) via a crafted MSDOS partition table with an extended partition boot record at zero offset.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5011` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

bsdutils - 2.33.1-0.1ubuntu2
No subscription required

fdisk - 2.33.1-0.1ubuntu2
libblkid1 - 2.33.1-0.1ubuntu2
libfdisk1 - 2.33.1-0.1ubuntu2
libmount1 - 2.33.1-0.1ubuntu2
libsmartcols1 - 2.33.1-0.1ubuntu2
libuuid1 - 2.33.1-0.1ubuntu2
mount - 2.33.1-0.1ubuntu2
rfkill - 2.33.1-0.1ubuntu2
util-linux - 2.33.1-0.1ubuntu2
util-linux-locales - 2.33.1-0.1ubuntu2
uuid-runtime - 2.33.1-0.1ubuntu2
No subscription required

notes.Note: eslerm> upstream patch does not apply to 2.20.1 (trusty)

criterions.comment: util-linux package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.33.1-0.1ubuntu2').
util-linux package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.33.1-0.1ubuntu2').
